Sentence.value: An abdominal x-ray is an imaging test to look at organs and structures in the abdomen.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: An [[abdominal x-ray|C0034573]] is an imaging test to look at [[organs|C0178784]] and structures in the abdomen.

Sentence.value: The test is done in a hospital radiology department.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: The [[test|C0039593]] is done in a [[hospital radiology department|C0034600]].

Sentence.value: Before having the x-ray, tell the provider the following: - If you are pregnant or think you could be pregnant - Have an IUD inserted - Have had a barium contrast x-ray in the last 4 days - If you have taken any medicines such as Pepto Bismol in the last 4 days (this type of medicine can interfere with the x-ray) You wear a hospital gown during the x-ray procedure.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Before having the [[x-ray|C0043309]], tell the provider the following: - If you are pregnant or think you could be pregnant - Have an IUD inserted - Have had a barium contrast [[x-ray|C0043309]] in the last 4 days - If you have taken any [[medicines|C0013227]] such as [[Pepto Bismol|C0136074]] in the last 4 days (this type of medicine can interfere with the x-ray) You wear a hospital gown during the x-ray procedure.

Sentence.value: Your provider may order this test to: - Diagnose a pain in the abdomen or unexplained nausea - Identify suspected problems in the urinary system, such as a kidney stone - Identify blockage in the intestine - Locate an object that has been swallowed - Help diagnose diseases, such as tumors or other conditions
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Your provider may order this test to: - Diagnose a pain in the abdomen or unexplained nausea - Identify suspected problems in the urinary system, such as a [[kidney stone|C0022650]] - Identify blockage in the [[intestine|C0021853]] - Locate an object that has been swallowed - Help diagnose diseases, such as tumors or other conditions
